intro: Antrophyum novae-caledoniae, commonly known as the New Caledonia antrophyum, is a rare and endemic fern native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the humid and nutrient-rich soil. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for its protection.
